00068 // the geometry methods of cones are fairly CPU intensive
00069 // => we will not bother to use templates to have separate
00070 // versions for x-cones, y-cones, etc.

00102 class EGS_CONES_EXPORT EGS_SimpleCone : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00103 
00104 protected:
00105 
00106     EGS_Vector    xo;          // the cone apex.
00107     EGS_Vector    a;           // the cone axis.
00108     EGS_Float     gamma, g12;  // tangent of opening angle and 1+gamma^2
00109     EGS_Float     g12i;        // 1/sqrt(g12)
00110     EGS_Float     d1;          // (-) closing plane distance (if closed)
00111     EGS_Float     Ro, Ro2;     // radius at base (if closed) and Ro^2
00112     bool          open;        // true if cone is open
00113     bool          is_cyl;      // true if cone is cylindrical (within hard-coded tolerance)
00114     static string type;
00115 
00116 public:
00117 
00118     // constructor
00119     EGS_SimpleCone (const EGS_Vector &Xo, const EGS_Vector &A, EGS_Float Gamma,
00120                     const EGS_Float *distance=0, const string &N="")
00121 
00122         : EGS_BaseGeometry(N), xo(Xo), a(A), gamma(Gamma), g12(1+Gamma*Gamma),
00123           open(true), is_cyl(false) {
00124 
00125         a.normalize();
00126         g12i = 1/sqrt(g12);
00127 
00128         // closed cone
00129         if (distance) {
00130             if (*distance > 0) {
00131                 open = false;
00132                 d1 = -(*distance);
00133                 Ro = -d1*gamma;
00134                 Ro2 = Ro*Ro;
00135             }
00136             else
00137                 egsWarning("EGS_SimpleCone: the distance to the closing plane must be positive\n");
00138         }
00139         nreg = 1;
00140     }
00141 
00142     // constructor
00143     EGS_SimpleCone (const EGS_Vector &Xo, const EGS_Vector &A, EGS_Float dz,
00144                     EGS_Float Rtop, EGS_Float Rbottom, bool Open=true, const string &N="")
00145 
00146         : EGS_BaseGeometry(N), a(A), open(Open), is_cyl(false) {
00147 
00148         a.normalize();
00149 
00150         // avoid round-off problems.
00151         if (fabs(Rtop - Rbottom) < 2e-5) {          // flag cylinders to avoid round-off problems
00152             is_cyl = true;
00153             xo = Xo;
00154             Ro = Rtop;
00155             Ro2 = Ro*Ro;
00156             gamma = 0;
00157             g12 = 1;
00158             g12i = 1;
00159             d1 = -dz;
00160         }
00161         else if (Rtop < Rbottom) {                  // cone is opening along axis vector a
00162             EGS_Float aux = dz*Rtop/(Rbottom-Rtop);
00163             xo = Xo - a*aux;
00164             gamma = Rbottom/(aux+dz);
00165             g12 = 1 + gamma*gamma;
00166             g12i = 1/sqrt(g12);
00167             d1 = -dz-aux;
00168         }
00169         else {                                      // cone is closing along axis vector a
00170             EGS_Float aux = dz*Rbottom/(Rtop-Rbottom);
00171             xo = Xo + a*(aux+dz);
00172             a *= (-1);
00173             gamma = Rtop/(aux+dz);
00174             g12 = 1 + gamma*gamma;
00175             g12i = 1/sqrt(g12);
00176             d1 = -dz-aux;
00177         }
00178     }
00179 
00180     // destructor
00181     ~EGS_SimpleCone() {}
00182 
00183     // isInside
00184     bool isInside (const EGS_Vector &x) {
00185 
00186         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);                        // vector from cone apex xo to test point x
00187         EGS_Float  aa = xp*a;                       // projection of xp on axis vector a
00188 
00189         // check bounds along cone axis
00190         if (!open && (aa < 0 || aa+d1 > 0)) return false;
00191 
00192         // check cylinder radius
00193         if (is_cyl) {
00194             EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2() - aa*aa;
00195             if (r2 <= Ro2) return true;
00196             return false;
00197         }
00198 
00199         // check cone radius
00200         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();
00201         if (r2 <= aa*aa*g12 ) return true;
00202         return false;
00203     }
00204 
00205     // isWhere
00206     int isWhere (const EGS_Vector &x) {
00207         if (isInside(x)) return 0;
00208         return -1;
00209     }
00210 
00211     // inside
00212     int inside (const EGS_Vector &x) {
00213         return isWhere(x);
00214     }
00215 
00216     // howfar
00217     int howfar (int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
00218                 EGS_Float &t, int *newmed=0, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
00219 
00220         EGS_Vector  xp(x-xo);                       // vector from cone apex xo to test point x
00221         EGS_Float   aa = xp*a;                      // projection of xp on cone axis a
00222         EGS_Float   b  = u*a;                       // cos(t) between axis a and step vector u
00223         EGS_Float   r2 = xp.length2();              // length^2 of xp
00224         EGS_Float   c  = u*xp;                      // projection of xp on step vector u
00225 
00226         // handle cylinder
00227         if (is_cyl) {
00228 
00229             // u is parallel to a (u and a are normalized)
00230             if (fabs(b) >= 1) return ireg;
00231 
00232             EGS_Float A = 1 - b*b;                  // A = 1-cos^2(t) = sin^2(t)
00233             EGS_Float B = c - b*aa;                 // B = u * [xp - (xp*a)a] =  u * n
00234             EGS_Float C = r2 - aa*aa - Ro2;         // C = n^2 - R0^2
00235             EGS_Float d;                            // distance to cylinder along u
00236 
00237             // from inside cylinder
00238             if (!ireg) {
00239                 EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;              // R0^2 - [ n^2 - ((n*u)/sint)^2 ]
00240                 if (D < 0 || (C > 0 && B > 0) ) d = 0;
00241                              // ^ hopefully a precision problem.
00242                 else d = B<=0 ? (sqrt(D)-B)/A : -C/(sqrt(D)+B);
00243             }
00244             // from outside cylinder
00245             else {
00246                 if (C < 0) {                        // inside cylinder: fp precision error
00247                     if (B < 0) d = 0;               // assume we are on the cylinder
00248                     else return ireg;               // u points away from cylinder
00249                 }
00250                 else {
00251                     if (B >= 0) return ireg;        // u points away from cylinder
00252                     EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;          // R0^2 - [ n^2 - ((n*u)/sint)^2 ]
00253                     if (D < 0) return ireg;         // u line does not intersect cylinder
00254                     d = C/(sqrt(D)-B);              // solve (n + d*(u-a(u*a)))^2 - R0^2 = 0
00255                 }
00256             }
00257 
00258             // distance to cylinder is longer than step length
00259             if (d > t) return ireg;
00260 
00261             // intersection with cylinder is beyond boundary planes
00262             if (!open) {
00263                 EGS_Float aux = aa + d*b;
00264                 if (aux < 0 || aux+d1 > 0) return ireg;
00265             }
00266 
00267             // intersect with cylinder
00268             t = d;
00269             if( newmed && ireg < 0 ) *newmed = med;
00270             if (normal) {
00271                 EGS_Float lam = aa+b*d;
00272                 EGS_Vector aux(xp+u*d-a*lam); aux.normalize();
00273                 *normal = ireg < 0 ? aux : aux*(-1);
00274             }
00275 
00276             return (!ireg ? -1 : 0);
00277         }
00278 
00279         // handle odd case where position numerically coincides with apex
00280         if (!xp.length2()) {
00281 
00282             int inew;
00283 
00284             // u is aiming inside the cone angle
00285             if (b >= g12i) {                        // g12i = cos(t_cone); b = cos(t)
00286                 inew = 0;
00287                 if (ireg < 0) {                     // we are coming from outside
00288                     t = 0;
00289                     if (newmed) *newmed = med;
00290                     if (normal) *normal = a*(-1);
00291                 }
00292                 else if (!open && b>0) {            // check closing plane
00293                     EGS_Float tt = -d1/b;           // tt = -(aa + d1)/b but aa=0 if here
00294                     if (tt <= t) {
00295                         t = tt;
00296                         inew = -1;
00297                         if (normal) *normal = a*(-1);
00298                     }
00299                 }
00300             }
00301             // u is aiming outside the cone angle
00302             else {
00303                 inew = -1;
00304                 if (ireg >= 0) {                    // we are coming from inside
00305                     t = 0;
00306                     if (normal) *normal = a;
00307                 }
00308             }
00309 
00310             // return new region index
00311             return inew;
00312         }
00313 
00314         // handle closing plane
00315         if (!open) {
00316 
00317             // from outside cone
00318             if (ireg < 0) {
00319                 if (aa+d1 > 0 && b < 0) {           // outside closing plane, moving towards it
00320                     EGS_Float tt = -(aa+d1)/b;      // distance to closing plane
00321                     if (tt <= t) {
00322                         EGS_Float r2p = r2 + tt*(tt + 2*c);
00323                         if( r2p <= d1*d1*g12 ) {    // enter via the closing plane
00324                             if (newmed) *newmed = med;
00325                             if (normal) *normal = a;
00326                             t = tt;
00327                             return 0;
00328                         }
00329                     }
00330 
00331                     // if we are inside the conical surface, the only way to enter is via the
00332                     // closing plane. but if (r2 <= aa*aa*g12), we didn't enter: simply return
00333                     if (r2 <= aa*aa*g12) return ireg;
00334                 }
00335             }
00336             // from inside cone
00337             else {
00338                 if (b > 0) {                        // moving towards the closing plane.
00339                     EGS_Float tt = -(aa+d1)/b;      // distance to closing plane
00340                     if (tt <= t) {
00341                         EGS_Float r2p = r2 + tt*(tt + 2*c);
00342                         if( r2p <= d1*d1*g12 ) {    // exit via the closing plane
00343                             if (newmed) *newmed = -1;
00344                             if (normal) *normal = a*(-1);
00345                             t = tt;
00346                             return -1;
00347                         }
00348                     }
00349                 }
00350             }
00351         }
00352 
00353         // At this point, we cannot enter or exit via the closing plane; all we need to check
00354         // is the conical surface. solve for t: (x+t*u)^2 = g12*[(x+t*u)*a]^2 (i.e., point
00355         // x+t*u is on cone surface).
00356         // solution: t = (-B +- sqrt(B^2-A*C))/A
00357 
00358         EGS_Float A   = 1 - b*b*g12;                // 1 - cos^2(t)/cos^2(t_cone)
00359         EGS_Float B   = c - aa*b*g12;
00360         EGS_Float C   = r2 - aa*aa*g12;
00361         EGS_Float tt  = 1e30;
00362         EGS_Float lam = -1;
00363 
00364         if (fabs(A) < 1e-6) {
00365             // moving parallel to the cone surface (A=0, within hard-coded tolerance):
00366             // solution: t = -C/(2*B), if t>0
00367 
00368             if ( (!ireg && B>0) || (ireg && B<0)) {
00369                 EGS_Float ttt = -C/(2*B);           // solution
00370                 lam = aa+b*ttt;                     // (x+t*u)*a >= 0: on "positive" cone
00371                 if (ttt >= 0 && lam >= 0) tt = ttt; // distance to cone surface
00372             }
00373         }
00374         else {
00375             // general solution, guarding against numerical instability
00376             // solution: t = (-B +- sqrt(B^2-A*C))/A
00377             //
00378             // pick the smallest positive root
00379             // A*C > 0 => roots have same sign
00380             // A*C < 0 => roots have opposite sign
00381             //
00382             // if C<0, then if A>0 pick '+ root',
00383             //         else if A<0 we must have B>0 for positive roots: pick '+ root'
00384             //         (guard against cancellation if B>0)
00385             //
00386             // if C>0, then if A<0 roots have opposite signs: pick '- root' (-|A| flips sign)
00387             //         else if A>0 we must have B<0 for positive roots: pick '- root'
00388             //         (guard against cancellation if B<0)
00389             //
00390             // by testing for ireg instead of the sign of C, we:
00391             // 1) avoid numerical instability at C=0
00392             // 2) reverse the choice for the upper cone: largest positive root or negative one.
00393 
00394             EGS_Float ttt = -1;
00395             EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;                  // determinant
00396             if (D<0) return ireg;                   // no real solution: no intersection
00397 
00398             if (!ireg && !(A<0 && B<0)) {           // inside cone
00399                 if (B>0) ttt = -C/(B+sqrt(D));
00400                 else     ttt = (sqrt(D)-B)/A;
00401             }
00402             else if (ireg && !(A>0 && B>0)) {       // outside cone
00403                 if (B<0) ttt = C/(sqrt(D)-B);
00404                 else     ttt = -(sqrt(D)+B)/A;
00405             }
00406             else return ireg;                       // no intersection
00407 
00408             lam = aa+b*ttt;                         // (x+t*u)*a >= 0: on "positive" cone
00409             if (ttt >= -2e-5 && lam >= 0) tt = ttt; // why the hard-coded -2e-5 bound??
00410         }
00411 
00412         // distance too far, or intersection beyond bounding plane
00413         if (tt > t || (!open && ireg && d1 + aa + tt*b > 0)) return ireg;
00414 
00415 
00416         // set distance and new region
00417         t = tt;
00418         int inew = ireg ? 0 : -1;
00419 
00420         // set medium and surface normal
00421         if (newmed) *newmed = inew ? -1 : med;
00422         if (normal) {
00423             *normal = xp + u*t - a*(lam*g12);
00424             normal->normalize();
00425             if (!ireg) *normal *= (-1);
00426         }
00427 
00428         // return new region
00429         return inew;
00430     }
00431 
00432 
00433     // hownear
00434     EGS_Float hownear (int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
00435 
00436         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);                        // position with respect to cone origin
00437         EGS_Float aa = xp*a;                        // position along cone axis
00438         EGS_Float ag = aa*gamma;                    // cone radius at axis position
00439         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();                // distance squared to cone origin
00440 
00441         // cylindrical case
00442         if (is_cyl) {
00443 
00444             // open, or within bounding planes
00445             if (open || (aa > 0 && aa+d1 < 0)) {
00446                 r2 = sqrt(r2 - aa*aa);              // radial distance from axis
00447                 if (ireg) return r2-Ro;             // from outside
00448                 else return Ro-r2;                  // from inside
00449             }
00450 
00451             r2 = sqrt(r2 - aa*aa);                  // radial distance from axis
00452 
00453             // inside the radius of cylinder: shortest distance is to closing plane
00454             if (r2 < Ro) {
00455                 if (aa<0) return -aa;               // distance to "0" closing plane
00456                 else return aa+d1;                  // distance to "d1" closing plane
00457             }
00458 
00459             // outside the radius of cylinder: shortest distance is to cylinder cap "corner"
00460             EGS_Float aux = r2-Ro;
00461             if (aa<0) return sqrt(aa*aa + aux*aux); // distance to "0" cap
00462             EGS_Float tp = aa+d1;
00463             return sqrt(tp*tp + aux*aux);           // distance to "d1" cap
00464 
00465         }
00466 
00467         // inside "negative" cone lobe
00468         if (aa < 0 && ag*ag > r2*g12) {             // cone tip is the nearest point
00469             return sqrt(r2);
00470         }
00471 
00472         // compute useful distances
00473         EGS_Float r2a2 = r2-aa*aa;                  // distance^2 to cone axis
00474         EGS_Float r2a  = sqrt(r2a2);                // distance to cone axis
00475         EGS_Float tc = fabs((ag-r2a)*g12i);         // distance to cone (perp. to cone surface)
00476 
00477         // open cone: tc is the shortest distance
00478         if (open) return tc;
00479 
00480         // closed cone: check closing plane
00481         EGS_Float tp = d1+aa;                       // signed axial distance to closing plane
00482 
00483         // inside cone
00484         if (!ireg) {
00485             tp = -tp;                               // adjust sign of distance
00486             if (tp < tc) tc = tp;                   // pick shortest distance
00487         }
00488         // outside, but inside conical surface
00489         else if (tp > 0 && r2 < aa*aa*g12 ) {
00490             if (r2a2 > Ro2) {                       // outside the cone base cylinder
00491                 EGS_Float aux = r2a - Ro;
00492                 tc = sqrt(tp*tp + aux*aux);         // nearest point is cone base "corner"
00493             }
00494             else tc = tp;                           // inside the cone base cylinder
00495         }
00496         // outside, and outside conical surface
00497         else if (tp + tc*gamma*g12i > 0 ) {         // nearest point is cone base "corner"
00498             EGS_Float aux = r2a + d1*gamma;         // distance to cone base cylinder
00499             tc = sqrt(aux*aux + tp*tp);             // distance to cone base "corner"
00500         }
00501 
00502         // return shortest distance to cone
00503         return tc;
00504     }
00505 
00506     // getType accessor
00507     const string &getType() const { return type; }

00510     void printInfo() const;

00513     EGS_Vector getApex() const { return xo; }
00514

00516     EGS_Vector getAxis() const { return a; }
00517

00519     EGS_Float getGamma() const { return gamma; }
00520 
00521     // getRadius accessor
00522     EGS_Float getRadius(const EGS_Vector &x) const {
00523         if (is_cyl) return Ro;
00524         EGS_Float xp = (x-xo)*a;
00525         if (xp <= 0) return 0;
00526         return xp*gamma;
00527     }
00528 };

00530 
00531 // A set of cones having the same axis and opening angle and
00532 // apexes along the cone axis:
00533 //
00534 //          /\
00535 //         /  \
00536 //        /    \
00537 //       /  /\  \
00538 //      /  /  \  \
00539 //     /  /    \  \
00540 //    /  /  /\  \  \
00541 //   /  /  /  \  \  \
00542 //
00543 // That sort of geometry is useful for modelling e.g. the tip of
00544 // many ionization chambers.
00545 //
00546 
00573 class EGS_ParallelCones : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00574 
00575     EGS_Vector   *xo;           // the cone apexes
00576     EGS_Vector   a;             // the cone axis.
00577     EGS_Float    gamma, g12;    // tangent of opening angle and 1 + gamma^2
00578     EGS_Float    g12i;          // 1/sqrt(g12)
00579     EGS_Float    *d;            // distances from the first apex.
00580     int          nc;            // number of cones
00581     static string type;
00582 
00583 public:
00584 
00585     // constructor
00586     EGS_ParallelCones (int Nc, const EGS_Vector &Xo, const EGS_Vector &A, EGS_Float Gamma,
00587                        const EGS_Float *distances, const string &N="")
00588 
00589         : EGS_BaseGeometry(N), a(A), gamma(Gamma), g12(1+Gamma*Gamma), nc(Nc) {
00590 
00591         a.normalize();
00592         g12i = 1/sqrt(g12);
00593 
00594         if (nc < 1) nc=1;                           // enforce nc >= 1
00595         nreg = nc;                                  // one region per cone
00596         xo = new EGS_Vector[nc];                    // vector of cone apex positions
00597         xo[0] = Xo;                                 // apex of first cone
00598 
00599         // more than one cone
00600         if (nc > 1) {
00601             EGS_Float
00602             d_old = 0;
00603             d = new EGS_Float [nc-1];
00604             for (int j=1; j<nc; j++) {
00605                 d[j-1] = distances[j-1];
00606                 if (d[j-1] <= d_old)
00607                     egsFatal("EGS_ParallelCones: " "distances must be in increasing order\n");
00608                 xo[j] = xo[0] + a*d[j-1];
00609                 d_old = d[j-1];
00610             }
00611         }
00612     }
00613 
00614     // destructor
00615     ~EGS_ParallelCones() {
00616         delete [] xo;
00617         if (nc > 1) delete [] d;
00618     }
00619 
00620     // isInside
00621     bool isInside (const EGS_Vector &x) {
00622         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo[0]);                     // current position with respect to apex
00623         EGS_Float aa = xp*a;                        // current axial position
00624         if (aa < 0) return false;                   // on "negative" side of cones
00625         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();                // distance^2 to apex
00626         if (r2 <= aa*aa*g12) return true;           // inside outer cone
00627         return false;
00628     };
00629 
00630     // isWhere
00631     int isWhere (const EGS_Vector &x) {
00632         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo[0]);                     // current position with respect to apex
00633         EGS_Float aa = xp*a;                        // current axial position
00634         if (aa < 0) return -1;                      // on "negative" side of apex
00635         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();                // distance^2 to apex
00636         if (r2 > aa*aa*g12) return -1;              // outside outer cone
00637         EGS_Float r2a2 = r2 - aa*aa;                // distance to cone set axis
00638         for (int j=0; j<nc-1; j++) {                // loop over all inner cones
00639             EGS_Float aj  = aa - d[j];              // distance to apex of cone j
00640             EGS_Float ajg = aj*gamma;               // length of cone j'th side up to aj
00641             if (aj < 0 || r2a2 > ajg*ajg) return j; // on "negative" side or outside of cone j
00642         }
00643         return nc-1;                                // then it must be in last cone
00644     }
00645 
00646     // inside
00647     int inside (const EGS_Vector &x) {
00648         return isWhere(x);
00649     }
00650 
00651     // howfar
00652     int howfar (int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u, EGS_Float &t,
00653                 int *newmed=0, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
00654 
00655         // not in innermost cone
00656         if (ireg < nc-1) {
00657             EGS_Vector xp;                          // a position
00658             bool hit = false;                       // howfar hit flag
00659 
00660             // apex position of "next" inner cone
00661             if (ireg < 0) xp = x-xo[0];             // apex of outer cone
00662             else xp = x-xo[ireg+1];                 // apex of next inner cone
00663 
00664             // general solution
00665             EGS_Float aa = xp*a;                    // axial position in current cone
00666             EGS_Float b  = u*a;                     // cos(t), t = angle between a and u
00667             EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();            // distance^2 to current cone apex
00668             EGS_Float c  = u*xp;                    // projection of xp on u
00669             EGS_Float A  = 1 - b*b*g12;
00670             EGS_Float B  = c - aa*b*g12;
00671             EGS_Float C  = r2 - aa*aa*g12;
00672             EGS_Float tt = 1e30;
00673             EGS_Float lam = -1;
00674 
00675             // moving parallel to cone surface
00676             if (fabs(A) < 1e-6) {                   // guarding against /0 in general solution
00677                 EGS_Float ttt = -C/(2*B);           // distance to hit
00678                 lam = aa+b*ttt;                     // axial position of hit
00679                 if (ttt >= 0 && lam >= 0) {
00680                     tt  = ttt;
00681                     hit = true;
00682                 }
00683             }
00684             // general solution
00685             else {
00686                 EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;
00687                 if( D >= 0 && !( A > 0 && B > 0 ) ) {
00688                     EGS_Float ttt = B < 0 ? C/(sqrt(D)-B) : -(sqrt(D)+B)/A;
00689                     lam = aa+b*ttt;
00690                     if( ttt >= 0 && lam >= 0 ) { tt = ttt; hit = true; }
00691                 }
00692             }
00693             if (tt <= t) {
00694                 int inew = ireg < 0 ? 0 : ireg+1; t = tt;
00695                 if (newmed) *newmed = medium(inew);
00696                 if (normal) {
00697                     *normal = xp + u*t - a*(lam*g12);
00698                     normal->normalize();
00699                 }
00700                 return inew;
00701             }
00702             if (ireg < 0 || hit) return ireg;
00703         }
00704 
00705         // inside and not hitting the next inner cone.
00706         // check the previous outer cone
00707         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo[ireg]);
00708         EGS_Float aa = xp*a, b = u*a, r2 = xp.length2(), c = u*xp;
00709         EGS_Float A = 1 - b*b*g12, B = c - aa*b*g12, C = r2 - aa*aa*g12;
00710         EGS_Float to = 1e30, lamo = -1;
00711         if( fabs(A) < 1e-6 ) { // moving parallel to the cone surface.
00712             // for the outer cone we only have a solution if a*u < 0.
00713             // i.e. if we are moving towards the apex.
00714             if( b < 0 ) {
00715                 EGS_Float ttt = -C/(2*B); lamo = aa+b*ttt;
00716                 if( ttt >= 0 && lamo >= 0 ) to = ttt;
00717             }
00718         }
00719         else {
00720             EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;
00721             // avoid numerical problems when |A*C| << |B|
00722             if( D >= 0 && !(A < 0 && B < 0) ) {
00723                 EGS_Float ttt = B > 0 ? -C/(B+sqrt(D)) : (sqrt(D)-B)/A;
00724                 lamo = aa+b*ttt;
00725                 if( ttt >= 0 && lamo >= 0 ) to = ttt;
00726             }
00727         }
00728         if( to <= t ) {
00729             t = to; int inew = ireg-1;
00730             if( newmed ) *newmed = inew < 0 ? -1 : medium(inew);
00731             if( normal ) {
00732                 *normal = xp + u*t - a*(lamo*g12);
00733                 normal->normalize();
00734             }
00735             return inew;
00736         }
00737         return ireg;
00738     }
00739 
00740     // hownear
00741     EGS_Float hownear (int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
00742         EGS_Float tc;
00743         if (ireg < 0 || ireg < nc-1) {
00744             EGS_Vector xp;
00745             if( ireg < 0 ) xp = x - xo[0];
00746             else xp = x - xo[ireg+1];
00747             EGS_Float aa = xp*a;
00748             EGS_Float ag = aa*gamma;
00749             EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();
00750             if (aa < 0 && ag*ag > r2*g12) tc = sqrt(r2);
00751             else tc = fabs((ag-sqrt(r2-aa*aa))*g12i);
00752             if (ireg < 0) return tc;
00753         }
00754         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo[ireg]);
00755         EGS_Float aa = xp*a;
00756         EGS_Float ag = aa*gamma;
00757         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();
00758         EGS_Float tco = fabs((ag-sqrt(r2-aa*aa))*g12i);
00759         return tco < tc ? tco : tc;
00760     }
00761 
00762     // getMaxStep
00763     int getMaxStep() const {
00764         return 2*nreg + 2;
00765     }
00766 
00767     // getType accessor
00768     const string &getType() const {
00769         return type;
00770     }
00771 
00772     // printInfo
00773     void printInfo() const;
00774 };
00775 
00776 
00777 // A set of cones having the same apex and axis but different opening angles.
00778 // If flag = 0, only cones below the apex.
00779 //         = 1, cones below and above the apex but excluding the space
00780 //              outside of the last cone
00781 //         = 2, all space
00782 
00826 class EGS_ConeSet : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
00827 
00828     EGS_Vector    xo;   // the common apex.
00829     EGS_Vector    a;    // the axis.
00830     EGS_Float     *gamma, *g12, *g12i;
00831     int           nc;
00832     int           flag;
00833 
00834     static string type;
00835 
00836 public:
00837 
00838     EGS_ConeSet(const EGS_Vector &Xo, const EGS_Vector &A, int Nc,
00839                 EGS_Float *Gamma, int Flag = 0, const string &Name = "") :
00840         EGS_BaseGeometry(Name), xo(Xo), a(A), flag(Flag) {
00841         a.normalize();
00842         if( Nc < 1 )
00843             egsFatal("EGS_ConeSet: number of cones must be positive\n");
00844         nc = Nc; gamma = new EGS_Float [nc]; g12 = new EGS_Float [nc];
00845         g12i = new EGS_Float [nc];
00846         if( flag < 0 || flag > 2 ) {
00847             egsWarning("EGS_ConeSet: flag must be 0,1 or 2, reseting to 0\n");
00848             flag = 0;
00849         }
00850         for(int j=0; j<nc; j++) {
00851             if( Gamma[j] <= 0 )
00852                 egsFatal("EGS_ConeSet: gamma's must be positive\n");
00853             if( j > 0 ) {
00854                 if( Gamma[j] <= gamma[j-1] ) egsFatal("EGS_ConeSet: "
00855                     "gamma's must be in increasing order\n");
00856             }
00857             gamma[j] = Gamma[j]; g12[j] = 1 + gamma[j]*gamma[j];
00858             g12i[j] = 1/sqrt(g12[j]);
00859         }
00860         if( flag == 0 ) nreg = nc;
00861         else nreg = 2*nc + 1;
00862         if( flag == 1 ) is_convex = false;
00863     }
00864 
00865     ~EGS_ConeSet() { delete [] gamma; delete [] g12; delete [] g12i; }
00866 
00867     bool isInside(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00868         if( flag == 2 ) return true;
00869         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo); EGS_Float aa = xp*a;
00870         if( flag == 0 && aa < 0 ) return false;
00871         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2();
00872         if( r2 <= aa*aa*g12[nc-1] ) return true;
00873         return false;
00874     }
00875 
00876     int isWhere(const EGS_Vector &x) {
00877         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo); EGS_Float aa = xp*a;
00878         if( flag == 0 && aa < 0 ) return -1;
00879         EGS_Float r2 = xp.length2(); int j;
00880         for(j=0; j<nc; j++) if( r2 <= aa*aa*g12[j] ) break;
00881         if( j < nc ) {
00882             if( aa >= 0 ) return j;
00883             return 2*nc-j;
00884         }
00885         if( flag != 2 ) return -1;
00886         return nc;
00887     }
00888 
00889     bool isRealRegion(int ireg) const {
00890         if( ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg ) return false;
00891         return flag != 1 ? true : (ireg != nc);
00892     }
00893 
00894     int inside(const EGS_Vector &x) { return isWhere(x); }
00895 
00896     int howfar(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
00897                EGS_Float &t, int *newmed = 0, EGS_Vector *normal = 0) {
00898         EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);
00899         EGS_Float aa = xp*a, b = u*a, r2 = xp.length2(), c = u*xp;
00900         //if( debug ) egsWarning(" ireg = %d x = (%g,%g,%g) a = %g"
00901         //     " b = %g r2 = %g c = %g\n",ireg,x.x,x.y,x.z,aa,b,r2,c);
00902         if( !xp.length2() ) {
00903             // handle odd case where position coincides with apex
00904             int inew = isWhere(xp + u);
00905             if( inew != ireg ) {
00906                 t = 0;
00907                 if( normal ) *normal = a;
00908                 if( newmed ) *newmed = inew >= 0 ? medium(inew) : -1;
00909             }
00910             return inew;
00911         }
00912         if( ireg != 0 && ireg != 2*nc ) {
00913             // Not in the inner-most cone.
00914             // If outside (ireg < 0 || flag=2 and ireg=nc), check for
00915             // intersection with the outer-most cone
00916             // If inside, check for intersection with the inner cone.
00917             EGS_Float gam12;
00918             if( ireg < 0 || ireg == nc ) gam12 = g12[nc-1];
00919             else gam12 = ireg < nc ? g12[ireg-1] : g12[2*nc-ireg-1];
00920             EGS_Float A=1-b*b*gam12, B=c-aa*b*gam12, C=r2-aa*aa*gam12;
00921             //if( debug ) egsWarning(" gam12 = %g A = %g B = %g "
00922             //        "C = %g\n",gam12,A,B,C);
00923             EGS_Float tt = -1, lam; bool hit = false;
00924             if( fabs(A) < 1e-6 ) {
00925                 if( (ireg < nc && b > 0) || (ireg >= nc && b < 0) )
00926                     tt = -C/(2*B);
00927             }
00928             else {
00929                 EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;
00930                 if( D >= 0 && !( A > 0 && B > 0 ) )
00931                     tt = B < 0 ? C/(sqrt(D)-B) : -(sqrt(D)+B)/A;
00932             }
00933             if( tt >= 0 ) {  // possible intersection
00934                 lam = aa+b*tt; int inew;
00935                 if( ireg == nc || ireg == -1 ) {
00936                     // outside the outer-most cone.
00937                     // if flag=1 or flag=2, we are allowed to hit either
00938                     // of the two cones
00939                     if( flag ) {
00940                         hit = true; inew = lam >= 0 ? nc-1 : nc+1;
00941                     }
00942                     // if flag=0, we are allowed to hit only the lower
00943                     // cone (lam >= 0)
00944                     else if( !flag && lam>=0 ) { hit = true; inew = nc-1; }
00945                 }
00946                 else {
00947                     // inside. In this case we are only allowed to hit
00948                     // the cone on the same side of the apex.
00949                     if( lam*aa >= 0 ) {
00950                         hit = true;
00951                         inew = lam >= 0 ? ireg-1 : ireg+1;
00952                     }
00953                 }
00954                 if( hit && tt <= t ) {
00955                     t = tt;
00956                     if( newmed ) *newmed = medium(inew);
00957                     if( normal ) {
00958                         *normal = xp + u*t - a*(lam*gam12);
00959                         normal->normalize();
00960                     }
00961                     return inew;
00962                 }
00963             }
00964             if( ireg < 0 || ireg == nc || hit ) return ireg;
00965         }
00966         //EGS_Float gam12 = ireg < nc-1 ? g12[ireg] : g12[2*nc-ireg];
00967         EGS_Float gam12 = ireg < nc ? g12[ireg] : g12[2*nc-ireg];
00968         EGS_Float A=1-b*b*gam12, B=c-aa*b*gam12, C=r2-aa*aa*gam12;
00969         EGS_Float tt=-1;
00970         if( fabs(A) < 1e-6 ) {
00971             if( (ireg < nc && b < 0) || (ireg > nc && b > 0) ) tt = -C/(2*B);
00972         }
00973         else {
00974             EGS_Float D = B*B-A*C;
00975             // avoid numerical problems when |A*C| << |B|
00976             if( D >= 0 && !(A < 0 && B < 0) ) {
00977                 tt = B > 0 ? -C/(B+sqrt(D)) : (sqrt(D)-B)/A;
00978             }
00979         }
00980         if( tt < 0 ) return ireg;
00981         EGS_Float lam = aa + b*tt;
00982         if( (ireg < nc && lam < 0) || (ireg > nc && lam > 0) ) return ireg;
00983         if( tt <= t ) {
00984             t = tt; int inew;
00985             if( ireg < nc ) {
00986                 inew = ireg+1; if( inew == nc && flag < 2 ) inew = -1;
00987             }
00988             else {
00989                 inew = ireg-1; if( inew == nc && flag < 2 ) inew = -1;
00990             }
00991             if( newmed ) *newmed = inew < 0 ? -1 : medium(inew);
00992             if( normal ) {
00993                 *normal = xp + u*t - a*(lam*gam12);
00994                 normal->normalize();
00995             }
00996             return inew;
00997         }
00998         return ireg;
00999     }
01000 
01001     EGS_Float hownear(int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
01002         EGS_Float tc; EGS_Vector xp(x-xo);
01003         EGS_Float aa = xp*a, r2 = xp.length2(), ag;
01004         //egsWarning("hownear: ireg = %d x = (%g,%g,%g) aa = %g r2 = %g\n",
01005         //        ireg,x.x,x.y,x.z,aa,r2);
01006         if( ireg != 0 && ireg != 2*nc ) {
01007             int i;
01008             if( ireg < 0 || ireg == nc ) i = nc-1;
01009             else i = ireg < nc ? ireg-1 : 2*nc-ireg-1;
01010             ag = aa*gamma[i];
01011             if( flag == 0 && aa < 0 && ag*ag > r2*g12[i] ) tc = sqrt(r2);
01012             else tc = fabs((fabs(ag)-sqrt(r2-aa*aa))*g12i[i]);
01013             //egsWarning(" i = %d ag = %g g12i = %g tc = %g\n",i,ag,g12i[i],tc);
01014             if( ireg < 0 || ireg == nc ) return tc;
01015         }
01016         EGS_Float gam12i;
01017         if( ireg < nc ) { ag = aa*gamma[ireg]; gam12i = g12i[ireg]; }
01018         else { ag = -aa*gamma[2*nc-ireg]; gam12i = g12i[2*nc-ireg]; }
01019         EGS_Float tco = fabs((ag-sqrt(r2-aa*aa))*gam12i);
01020         //egsWarning(" ag = %g tco = %g\n",ag,tco);
01021         return tco < tc ? tco : tc;
01022     }
01023 
01024     int getMaxStep() const { return 4*nreg + 2; }
01025 
01026     const string &getType() const { return type; }
01027 
01028     void printInfo() const;
01029 };
01030 
01031 //
01032 // A cone stack is a collection of cones with possible
01033 // different opening angles, apexes, etc., stacked together
01034 // This is very similar to the cone stack component module in BEAM
01035 //
01036 //
01037 #include <vector>
01038 using std::vector;
01039 
01098 class EGS_ConeStack : public EGS_BaseGeometry {
01099 
01100 public:
01101 
01102     // constructor (empty cone stack)
01103     EGS_ConeStack (const EGS_Vector &Xo, const EGS_Vector &A, const string &Name)
01104         : xo(Xo), a(A), nl(0), nltot(0), nmax(0), same_Rout(true), Rout(0), Rout2(0),
01105           EGS_BaseGeometry(Name) {
01106        a.normalize();
01107     }
01108 
01109     // destructor
01110     ~EGS_ConeStack() {
01111         clear(true);
01112     }
01113 
01114     // add a layer
01115     void addLayer (EGS_Float thick, const vector<EGS_Float> &rtop,
01116                    const vector<EGS_Float> &rbottom,
01117                    const vector<string> &med_names);
01118 
01119     // get medium
01120     int medium (int ireg) const {
01121         int il = ireg/nmax; int ir = ireg - il*nmax;
01122         return cones[il][ir]->medium(0);
01123     }
01124 
01125     // isInside
01126     bool isInside (const EGS_Vector &x) {
01127         EGS_Float p = x*a;
01128         if (p < pos[0] || p > pos[nl] ) return false;
01129         int il = findRegion(p,nl+1,pos);
01130         return cones[il][nr[il]-1]->isInside(x);
01131     }
01132 
01133     // isWhere
01134     int isWhere (const EGS_Vector &x) {
01135         EGS_Float p = x*a;
01136         if (p < pos[0] || p > pos[nl] ) return -1;
01137         int il = findRegion(p,nl+1,pos);
01138         int ir = isWhere(il,x);
01139         return ir < 0 ? -1 : il*nmax+ir;
01140     }
01141 
01142     // inside
01143     int inside (const EGS_Vector &x) {
01144         return isWhere(x);
01145     }
01146 
01147     // isRealRegion
01148     bool isRealRegion (int ireg) const {
01149         if (ireg < 0 || ireg >= nreg ) return false;
01150         int il = ireg/nmax; int ir = ireg - il*nmax;
01151         return (ir < nr[il]);
01152     }
01153 
01154     // howfar
01155     int howfar (int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x, const EGS_Vector &u,
01156                 EGS_Float &t, int *newmed=0, EGS_Vector *normal=0) {
01157 
01158         EGS_Float xp = x*a;
01159         EGS_Float up = u*a;
01160         int dir;
01161 
01162         // inside conestack
01163         if (ireg >= 0) {
01164             EGS_Float tp;
01165             int il = ireg/nmax;                     // layer index
01166 
01167             // calculate distance to plane
01168             if (up > 0) {                           // u points along conestack axis
01169                 dir = 1;                            // positive direction
01170                 tp = (pos[il+1]-xp)/up;             // distance to 'next' plane
01171             }
01172             else if (up < 0) {                      // u points against conestack axis
01173                 dir = -1;                           // negative direction
01174                 tp = (pos[il]-xp)/up;               // distance to 'previous' plane
01175             }
01176             else {                                  // u is perpendicular to a (u*a = 0)
01177                 dir = 0;                            // null direction
01178                 tp = 1e30;                          // init to large distance
01179             }
01180             bool hitp = false;                      // assume we don't hit the plane
01181             if (tp <= t) {                          // check against maximum distance t
01182                 hitp = true;                        // we hit the plane
01183                 t = tp;                             // set t = distance to plane
01184             }
01185 
01186             // distance to outer cone
01187             int ir = ireg - il*nmax;                // cone index in current layer
01188             bool hitc = false;                      // assume we don't hit the cone
01189             int irnew = cones[il][ir]->howfar(0,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
01190             if (irnew < 0) {
01191                 hitc = true;                        // hit the next cone
01192                 irnew = ir < nr[il]-1 ? ir+1 : -1;  // next cone region, or -1 if beyond last cone
01193             }
01194 
01195             // distance to inner cone (for all but innermost cone)
01196             if (ir > 0) {
01197                 int irnew1 = cones[il][ir-1]->howfar(-1,x,u,t,newmed,normal);
01198                 if (!irnew1) {
01199                     hitc = true;                    // hit the previous cone
01200                     irnew = ir-1;                   // previous cone region
01201                 }
01202             }
01203 
01204             // hit a cone boundary
01205             if (hitc) {
01206                 if (irnew < 0) return irnew;        // we are moving out of conestack, return -1
01207                 if (newmed) *newmed = cones[il][irnew]->medium(0);
01208                 return il*nmax + irnew;
01209             }
01210 
01211             // did not hit a plane (nor a cone: should not happen!)
01212             if (!hitp) return ireg;
01213 
01214             // change layer
01215             int ilnew = il + dir;                   // new layer index
01216             if (normal) *normal = dir > 0 ? a*(-1) : a;
01217             if (ilnew < 0 || ilnew >= nl) return -1;// beyond conestack bounding planes => outside
01218 
01219             // next layer radii are congruent (add nmax to ireg)
01220             if (dir > 0 && flag[il] >= 2) {
01221                 if (newmed) *newmed = cones[il+1][ir]->medium(0);
01222                 return ireg+nmax;
01223             }
01224 
01225             // previous layer radii are congruent (subtract nmax from ireg)
01226             if (dir < 0 && (flag[il] == 1 || flag[il] == 3) ) {
01227                 if (newmed) *newmed = cones[il-1][ir]->medium(0);
01228                 return ireg-nmax;
01229             }
01230 
01231             // figure out region index in new layer
01232             il += dir;                              // new layer index
01233             EGS_Vector tmp(x+u*t);                  // position of the hit on new layer
01234             ir = isWhere(il,tmp);                   // get region index in that layer
01235             if (ir<0) return ir;                    // moved out of constack
01236             if (newmed) *newmed = cones[il][ir]->medium(0);
01237             return il*nmax+ir;                      // return overall new region index
01238         }
01239 
01240         // outside of conestack
01241 
01242         EGS_Float  ttot=0;                          // cumulative travel distance
01243         EGS_Float  tp;                              // distance to next plane
01244         EGS_Vector tmp(x);                          // running position
01245         int il;                                     // current layer index
01246 
01247         // outside the first boundary plane
01248         if (xp <= pos[0]) {
01249             if (up <= 0) return ireg;               // moving away from conestack: no hit
01250             tp = (pos[0]-xp)/up;                    // distance to first boundary plane
01251             if (tp > t) return ireg;                // distance greater than maximum t: no hit
01252             tmp += u*tp;                            // move to first plane
01253             ttot = tp;                              // increase cumulative travel distance
01254             il   = 0;                               // index of current layer
01255             int ir = isWhere(0, tmp);               // region index in first layer
01256             if (ir >= 0) {                          // hit inside a cone in first layer: we're done
01257                 //***************************************************************
01258                 // EMH April 12 2013: Called from outside, but isWhere reports it is inside.
01259                 // This is due to either the particle at a boundary or to round-off errors near a boundary.
01260                 // To avoid getting into an infinite loop, check again if particle exits
01261                 // the geometry from region ir.
01262                 //
01263                 // FT December 4 2013:
01264                 // this isWhere call is using the tmp position and the LOCAL ir region number in
01265                 // layer 0 of the ConeStack, so it is not inconsistent if x is outside and ir>=0.
01266                 // BUT indeed we may be glancing on a "corner" of the ConeStack, so we should still
01267                 // check if a subsequent call to howfar(ir,tmp,...) takes us outside within epsilon.
01268                 // It that case we are not really entering the geometry.
01269                 EGS_Float tb = 1e30; int inew_g = howfar(ir,tmp,u,tb,0,normal);
01270                 if (inew_g < 0 && tb <= epsilon) return ireg; // exits geometry
01271                 //***************************************************************
01272                 t = tp;                             // distance to hit is distance to plane
01273                 if (newmed) *newmed = cones[0][ir]->medium(0);
01274                 if (normal) *normal = a*(-1);
01275                 return ir;                          // return region number
01276             }
01277         }
01278 
01279         // outside the last boundary plane
01280         else if (xp >= pos[nl]) {
01281             if (up >= 0) return ireg;               // moving away from the conestack: no hit
01282             tp = (pos[nl]-xp)/up;                   // distance to last boundary plane
01283             if (tp > t) return ireg;                // distance greater than maximum t: no hit
01284             tmp += u*tp;                            // hit position on last plane
01285             ttot = tp;                              // increase cumulative travel distance
01286             il = nl-1;                              // index of last plane
01287             int ir = isWhere(il, tmp);              // region index in last layer
01288             if (ir >= 0) {                          // hit inside a cone in first layer: we're done
01289                 //***************************************************************
01290                 // EMH April 12 2013: Called from outside, but isWhere reports it is inside.
01291                 // This is due to either the particle at a boundary or to round-off errors near a boundary.
01292                 // To avoid getting into an infinite loop, check again if particle exits
01293                 // the geometry from region ir.
01294                 //
01295                 // FT December 4 2013:
01296                 // this isWhere call is using the tmp position and the LOCAL ir region number in
01297                 // layer il of the ConeStack, so it is not inconsistent if x is outside and ir>=0.
01298                 // BUT indeed we may be glancing on a "corner" of the ConeStack, so we should still
01299                 // check if a subsequent call to howfar(il*nmax+ir) takes us outside within epsilon.
01300                 // It that case we are not really entering the geometry.
01301                 EGS_Float tb = 1e30; int inew_g = howfar(il*nmax+ir,tmp,u,tb,0,normal);
01302                 if (inew_g < 0 && tb <= epsilon) return ireg; // exits geometry
01303                 //***************************************************************
01304                 t = tp;                             // distance to hit is distance to plane
01305                 if( newmed ) *newmed = cones[il][ir]->medium(0);
01306                 if( normal ) *normal = a;           // set normal
01307                 return il*nmax+ir;                  // return region number
01308             }
01309         }
01310 
01311         // outside conestack, but within conestack boundary planes
01312         else {
01313 
01314             if (same_Rout) {
01315                 // all outer "cones" are actually cylinders and all have the same radius. This
01316                 // simplifies the logic a lot: just need to check against outer cylindrical cone of
01317                 // the first layer: cones[0][nr[0]-1]. Don't forget to use temporary and normal
01318                 // pointers here so that normal is only updated if the hit lies within the
01319                 // conestack boundary planes!
01320 
01321                 EGS_Float tt = t;
01322                 EGS_Vector tmp_normal;
01323 
01324                 //***************************************************************
01325                 // EMH, April 12 2013: To prevent round-off error situations
01326                 // where particles are stuck near boundaries or when a particle
01327                 // seats at a boundary, check both, where it is, and whether it exits
01328                 // the geometry. irnow SHOULD be -1, but if a particle is at a boundary or
01329                 // very close to one, isWhere returns irnow >= 0 values.
01330                 int irnow = isWhere(x);// irnow > 0 indicates round-off error near boundary
01331                                        // irnow = -1 indicates proper call from outside
01332                 // howfar call using irnow instead of -1 in the hope particle gets out of boundary
01333                 //
01334                 // int irnew = cones[0][nr[0]-1]->howfar(irnow,x,u,tt,0,&tmp_normal);
01335                 //
01336                 // FT December 10 2013:
01337                 // the howfar call above does not work because it uses irnow for the call to
01338                 // SimpleCone->howfar: SimpleCone regions can only be 0 (inside) or -1 (outside).
01339                 // If we find the inconsistent condition irnow >= 0 (inside, but call from outside),
01340                 // then we are on a boundary. We see if howfar takes us out within epsilon.
01341                 // If so, then we are not really entering the geometry.
01342 
01343                 // fp inconsistency: irnow >= 0 (inside) but called with ireg = -1 (outside)
01344                 if (irnow >= 0) {
01345                     EGS_Float tb = 1e30; int inew_g = howfar(irnow,x,u,tb,0,&tmp_normal);
01346                     if (inew_g < 0 && tb <= epsilon) return ireg; // exits geometry
01347                 }
01348                 //***************************************************************
01349 
01350                 int irnew = cones[0][nr[0]-1]->howfar(ireg,x,u,tt,0,&tmp_normal);
01351 
01352                 if (irnew < 0) return -1;           // no hit
01353                 EGS_Float aux = xp + up*tt;         // axis position of hit point on outer cylinder
01354                 if (aux < pos[0] || aux > pos[nl] ||// beyond conestack bounding planes
01355                     (aux == pos[0]  && up <= 0)   ||// on first plane, going out
01356                     (aux == pos[nl] && up >= 0)) {  // on last plane, going out
01357                     return -1;                      // => no hit: we're done
01358                 }
01359                 il = findRegion(aux,nl+1,pos);      // layer index for axis position aux
01360                 if (newmed) *newmed = cones[il][nr[il]-1]->medium(0);
01361                 if (normal) *normal = tmp_normal;   // set normal to normal from howfar
01362                 t = tt;                             // set distance
01363                 return il*nmax + nr[il]-1;          // return region index
01364             }
01365 
01366             // get layer index for current position, projected on the conestack axis
01367             il = findRegion(xp,nl+1,pos);
01368 
01369             // guard agains round-off errors by checking if the position
01370             // is inside the outer cone in this layer (it shouldn't be, as the
01371             // particle is outside) and returning if it is.
01372             bool isc = cones[il][nr[il]-1]->isInside(x);
01373             if (isc) {
01374                 // IK, March 7 2008: same problem as in CD geometry.
01375                 // we think we are outside but we just found we are inside.
01376                 // Hopefully a roundoff problem.
01377                 EGS_Float tp = 1e30;
01378                 if (up > 0) {
01379                     dir = 1;
01380                     tp = (pos[il+1] - xp)/up;
01381                 }
01382                 else if (up < 0) {
01383                     dir = -1;
01384                     tp = (pos[il] - xp)/up;
01385                 }
01386                 if (tp < epsilon) {
01387                     il += dir;
01388                     if (il < 0 || il >= nl) return ireg;
01389                     isc = cones[il][nr[il]-1]->isInside(x);
01390                 }
01391 
01392                 if (isc) {
01393                     EGS_Float tc = 1e30;
01394                     int isc_new = cones[il][nr[il]-1]->howfar(0,x,u,tc);
01395                     if (!(isc_new < 0 && tc < epsilon)) {
01396                         egsWarning("EGS_ConeStack::howfar: called from the outside"
01397                                    " but I find x=(%g,%g,%g) to be inside\n", x.x,x.y,x.z);
01398                         egsWarning("layer=%d distance to planes=%g\n",il,tp);
01399                         egsWarning("distance to outer cone=%g\n",tc);
01400                         error_flag = 1;
01401                         return ireg;
01402                     }
01403                 }
01404             }
01405         }
01406 
01407         // traverse layers until we hit a cone, or else move beyond conestack boundary planes
01408         while (1) {
01409 
01410             // calculate distance to next plane boundary
01411             if (up > 0) {                           // moving along conestack axis a
01412                 dir = 1;                            // positive direction
01413                 tp = (pos[il+1] - xp)/up;           // total distance to next plane
01414             }
01415             else if (up < 0) {                      // moving against conestack axis a
01416                 dir = -1;                           // negative direction
01417                 tp = (pos[il] - xp)/up;             // total distance to previous plane
01418             }
01419             else {                                  // moving perpendicular to axis (u*a = 0)
01420                 dir = 0;                            // null direction
01421                 tp  = 1e30;                         // init to large distance
01422             }
01423 
01424             // distance to outer cone in layer 'il'
01425             EGS_Float tt = t - ttot;                // remaining maximum distance
01426             int tmp_med;
01427             EGS_Vector tmp_normal;
01428             int irnew = cones[il][nr[il]-1]->howfar(-1,tmp,u,tt,&tmp_med,&tmp_normal);
01429             if (!irnew) {                           // hit the outer cone
01430                 if (tp > ttot + tt) {               // plane is further than cone: we're done
01431                     t = ttot+tt;                    // final distance to conestack
01432                     if (newmed) *newmed = tmp_med;      // set media
01433                     if (normal) *normal = tmp_normal;   // set normal
01434                     return il*nmax+nr[il]-1;        // return final region index
01435                 }
01436             }
01437             if (tp > t || !dir ) break;             // guard against glancing hits
01438             il += dir;                              // move to previous or next layer
01439             if (il < 0 || il >= nl) break;          // enforce conestack bounding planes
01440             ttot = tp;                              // increase cumulative travel distance
01441             tmp = x + u*tp;                         // move along to position hit on next plane
01442 
01443             int itest = isWhere(il,tmp);            // check where we are in next layer
01444             if (itest >= 0) {                       // we are inside a cone in next layer
01445                 t = ttot;                           // update distance
01446                 if (newmed) *newmed = cones[il][itest]->medium(0);
01447                 if (normal) *normal = dir > 0 ? a*(-1) : a;
01448                 return il*nmax + itest;             // return final region index
01449             }
01450         }
01451         return ireg;
01452     }
01453 
01454     // hownear
01455     EGS_Float hownear (int ireg, const EGS_Vector &x) {
01456 
01457         EGS_Float xp = x*a;                         // current position along the axis
01458         EGS_Float tp, tc;                           // distances
01459 
01460         // inside the conestack
01461         if (ireg >= 0) {
01462             int il = ireg/nmax;                     // current layer index
01463             int ir = ireg - il*nmax;                // region index in current layer
01464             tp = min(xp-pos[il],pos[il+1]-xp);      // min of distance to planes on either side
01465             tc = cones[il][ir]->hownear(0,x);       // distance to outer conical boundary
01466             if (ir > 0) tc = min(tc,cones[il][ir-1]->hownear(-1,x)); // to inner conical boundary
01467             return min(tp,tc);                      // return minimum distance
01468         }
01469 
01470         // outside the conestack; just check distances to layer planes, which is overkill, but in
01471         // general it would be worse to check hownear on the outer cones in all layer! To mitigate
01472         // hownear calls to layer planes, one can inscribe the conestack in a fitting envelope.
01473 
01474         if (xp <= pos[0])  return pos[0] - xp;      // distance to first layer plane
01475         if (xp >= pos[nl]) return xp - pos[nl];     // distance to last layer plane
01476         int il = findRegion(xp,nl+1,pos);           // find current layer index
01477         tp = min(xp-pos[il],pos[il+1]-xp);          // min of distance to planes on either side
01478         return min(tp,cones[il][nr[il]-1]->hownear(-1,x));  // min dist. to planes and outer cone
01479 
01480     }
01481 
01482     // getMaxStep
01483     int getMaxStep() const {
01484         int nstep = 0;
01485         for (int j=0; j<nl; ++j) nstep += 2*nr[j] + 1;
01486         return nstep + 1;
01487     }
01488 
01489     // getType
01490     const string &getType() const {
01491         return type;
01492     }

01494     // printInfo
01495     void printInfo() const;

01497     // nLayer
01498     int  nLayer() const {
01499         return nl;
01500     }

01502     // shiftLabels
01503     void shiftLabelRegions(const int i, const int index) {
01504         for (int k=0; k<labels[i].regions.size(); k++) {
01505             labels[i].regions[k] += index*nmax;
01506         }
01507     }

01511 protected:
01512 
01513     EGS_Vector  xo;             // the position of the top layer
01514     EGS_Vector  a;              // the axis
01515     int         nl;             // number of layers
01516     int         nltot;          // size of the arrays
01517     int         nmax;           // max. number of radii in all layers
01518     bool        same_Rout;      // true, if all layers have same outer radius
01519     EGS_Float   Rout, Rout2;    // outer radius (if same_Rout is true)
01520     EGS_Float   *pos;           // the plane positions dividing the layers
01521     int         *nr;            // number of radii in each layer
01522     int         *flag;          // a flag for each layer:
01523                                 //   = 0 -> top and bottom radii different from adjacent layers
01524                                 //   = 1 -> top radii are the same as bottom of previous layer
01525                                 //   = 2 -> bottom radii are the same as top of next layer
01526                                 //   = 3 -> top and bottom radii same as adjacent layers
01527     EGS_SimpleCone ***cones;    // the cones for each layer.
01528     static string type;

01531     void resize();

01533     // clear
01534     void clear(bool);

01536     // isWhere
01537     inline int isWhere (int il, const EGS_Vector &x) {
01538         if (!cones[il][nr[il]-1]->isInside(x)) return -1;
01539         for (int j=0; j<nr[il]-1; j++) {
01540             if (cones[il][j]->isInside(x)) return j;
01541         }
01542         return nr[il]-1;
01543     }
01544 };
